intro: Dalea tolteca, commonly known as the Toltec legume, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of central Mexico. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is known for its nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers in shades of pink and white, often arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Dalea tolteca is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy species adapted to arid environments.
